snippet: April’s increases were led by higher food prices and greater retailer and wholesaler profit margins.
abstract: Labor Department reports the Producer Price Index rose a seasonally adjusted 0.6 percent from March to April, after 0.5 percent increase from February to March; producer prices have risen 2.1 percent over last 12 months, biggest 12-month gain in more than two years.
lead_paragraph: April’s increases were led by higher food prices and greater retailer and wholesaler profit margins.

headline.main: Rise in U.S. Producer Prices Suggests Healthier Inflation
headline.print_headline: Rise in U.S. Producer Prices Suggests Healthier Inflation
